sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
epic_coverage: Infrastructure, User Experience, User Account Management, Core Calculator, Compliance
key_deliverables: Functional user registration & login via Cognito; Responsive app shell; Basic arithmetic calculator; Deployed VPC and Cognito infrastructure.
demo_objectives: Show responsive layout on mobile/desktop. Demonstrate user registration, logout, and login. Perform a basic calculation.
success_criteria: User authentication flow is end-to-end testable. Core infrastructure is provisioned. Basic calculator is functional.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory peer reviews for all Terraform code. Pair programming on critical infrastructure tasks.
integration_windows: Frontend/Backend integration for auth flow on Day 5-9.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 50% completion by day 5.

sprint_goal: Implement core scientific calculator functions and establish the backend database and CI/CD testing.
epic_coverage: Core Calculator Features, Infrastructure, Backend Service
key_deliverables: Trigonometric functions with angle mode switching. Input parsing for SI prefixes. Deployed Multi-AZ RDS database. CI pipeline with integration testing.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate sin(90) in DEG mode = 1. Demonstrate sin(pi/2) in RAD mode = 1. Show input of '1.5k' being used in a calculation.
success_criteria: All core scientific functions are implemented and tested. Database is provisioned and accessible. CI pipeline automatically runs integration tests.
risk_factors: Incorrect DB configuration (RISK-004). Complexity of CI service container setup.
mitigation_strategies: IaC scanning tools in pipeline. Allocate dedicated time for pipeline debugging.
integration_windows: CI pipeline validation with backend codebase on Day 3-6.

sprint_goal: Deliver persistent user data by implementing calculation history and user-defined variables for registered users.
key_deliverables: Persistent calculation history. Ability to define and save variables. Deployed ECS cluster, ALB, and basic API Gateway.
demo_objectives: Log in, perform calculations, refresh page, show history is still present. Define a variable, use it in a calculation.
success_criteria: History and variable data are successfully saved to and retrieved from the database for logged-in users. Core compute infrastructure is live.
risk_factors: API design mismatch between frontend and backend. Complexity of deploying ECS services via Terraform.
mitigation_strategies: Finalize API contracts on Day 1. Pair programming for ECS service deployment.
integration_windows: Full-stack integration of persistence features on Day 4-9.

sprint_goal: Complete the core data management features and achieve a fully deployable backend service.
key_deliverables: Full memory functions (M+, M-, MR, MC). Variable management (list, edit, delete). End-to-end API Gateway integration with ECS.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate full M+, MR, M-, MC workflow with persistence. Show the list of saved variables, edit one, and delete another.
success_criteria: All core data management CRUD operations are functional. The backend service is fully deployed and accessible via the API Gateway.
risk_factors: RISK-004 (API Gateway security). Complexity of API Gateway VPC Link integration.
mitigation_strategies: Security review of API Gateway configuration. Allocate buffer time for integration debugging.
integration_windows: API Gateway E2E testing on Day 5-8.

sprint_goal: Finalize the core scientific calculator feature set by adding remaining math functions, constants, and undo/redo capabilities.
key_deliverables: Logarithmic, exponential, power, root, and factorial functions. Undo/Redo functionality.
demo_objectives: Calculate log(100), 2^8, sqrt(64), 5!. Demonstrate undoing and redoing a typed expression.
success_criteria: All scientific functions from REQ-1-001 are implemented and tested. Undo/Redo works as expected.
risk_factors: Parser complexity for factorial operator precedence.
mitigation_strategies: Extensive unit testing for the expression parser.

sprint_goal: Build the foundational framework for Custom Modes, including the creation wizard (steps 1 & 2), the management list view, and backend persistence.
epic_coverage: Custom Mode Management, User Data Management
key_deliverables: A multi-step wizard for creating custom modes. UI to define name, description, and variables. A management screen listing all user-created modes. Backend persistence for custom modes.
demo_objectives: Start the 'Create New Mode' wizard. Define a name and several input/output variables. Save the draft and see it appear in the 'My Modes' list.
success_criteria: Users can create and save the basic structure of a custom mode. The list of modes is correctly fetched and displayed.
risk_factors: Complexity of the dynamic wizard UI state management.
mitigation_strategies: Use a state machine library or well-defined Redux slices to manage wizard state.
integration_windows: API integration for CRUD on custom modes on Day 4-9.

sprint_goal: Implement the core logic for the Custom Mode feature by building the formula editor with real-time validation.
key_deliverables: A formula editor with syntax highlighting. Real-time client-side validation for formula syntax, undefined variables, and disallowed functions.
demo_objectives: In the wizard, type a valid formula and see a success indicator. Type an invalid formula (e.g., using an undefined variable) and see a real-time error message.
success_criteria: The formula editor provides immediate, helpful feedback to the user, preventing the submission of invalid formulas.
risk_factors: RISK-001 (Sandbox security), complexity of integrating a math parser for real-time validation.
mitigation_strategies: Choose a well-vetted parsing library. Rigorous security review of the sandbox implementation.

sprint_goal: Complete the Custom Mode lifecycle by enabling users to launch, use, edit, and delete their creations.
key_deliverables: Ability to launch a custom mode and see a dynamically generated UI. Ability to execute calculations using the secure backend sandbox. Ability to edit and delete existing modes.
demo_objectives: Launch a custom mode, enter values, and see the calculated result. Edit a mode's formula and see the change reflected in a new calculation. Delete a mode.
success_criteria: The full CRUD lifecycle for custom modes is complete and functional. End-to-end formula execution meets performance and security requirements.
mitigation_strategies: Configure provisioned concurrency for the formula execution Lambda.
integration_windows: End-to-end testing of formula execution on Day 3-8.

sprint_goal: Launch the first set of Advanced Electronics Features: the Ohm's Law calculator and the Resistor Combination tool (Series & Parallel).
key_deliverables: A functional Ohm's Law mode. A functional Resistor Combination mode with series and parallel calculations.
demo_objectives: Enter V and I in Ohm's law mode and see R and P calculated. Add several resistors to a list and calculate their series and parallel equivalents.
success_criteria: All electronics features for this sprint are implemented with correct calculations and validation.
risk_factors: Low risk, as these are self-contained frontend features.
mitigation_strategies: Thorough unit testing of calculation logic.

sprint_goal: Deliver a robust offline experience by implementing service worker caching and automatic data synchronization for registered users.
key_deliverables: Service worker for offline application access. IndexedDB queuing for offline data changes. Automatic data sync upon reconnection with 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution.
demo_objectives: Load app, go offline, perform calculations, reload page (should work). Go back online, show data syncing to backend.
success_criteria: Application is fully functional offline for core features. All data changes made offline are successfully synced to the user's account upon reconnection.
risk_factors: RISK-002 (Data loss from sync bugs), RISK-006 (Stale service worker cache).
mitigation_strategies: Comprehensive E2E testing with network interception. Implement a UI prompt for users to refresh for new app versions.
integration_windows: Full-stack offline sync testing on Day 5-9.

sprint_goal: Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance by implementing comprehensive keyboard-only navigation and screen reader compatibility across the entire application.
key_deliverables: Full keyboard operability for all features. ARIA attribute implementation for all components. Color contrast compliance. Focus management for modals and dynamic content.
demo_objectives: Navigate the entire application and perform a key task from each feature area (e.g., create a custom mode) using only a keyboard and a screen reader.
success_criteria: The application passes a full WCAG 2.1 Level AA audit with no critical violations. Automated accessibility checks are integrated into the CI pipeline.
risk_factors: High effort; may require splitting into two sprints. Underestimation of remediation work for complex components.
mitigation_strategies: Split the work: focus on keyboard navigation in Sprint 11, and screen reader / ARIA in Sprint 12 if needed. Prioritize core features first.
burndown_target: Focus on completing core feature accessibility first.

sprint_goal: Finalize compliance and support features, including GDPR/CCPA data export, account deletion, and a searchable in-app help system.
epic_coverage: Compliance, User Account Management, User Experience
key_deliverables: GDPR/CCPA-compliant data export feature. Secure account deletion feature. A searchable, in-app help system powered by Docusaurus.
demo_objectives: Request a data export and show the resulting email/file. Delete a test user account and show they can no longer log in. Open the help system and search for a feature.
success_criteria: All compliance requirements are met and tested. The help system is functional and integrated.
risk_factors: Complexity of orchestrating the asynchronous data export job (SQS, Lambda, S3).
mitigation_strategies: Thorough integration testing of the data export flow.
integration_windows: End-to-end testing of data export and account deletion on Day 4-8.
